section.title: General safety information
section.note: Scalding can occur from hot steam as well. Be careful when lifting lids from hot food
Never ever, ever leave cooking foods unattended – not even for a minute.
Keep young children out of the kitchen while cooking.
Don’t leave the kitchen with pots and pans cooking on the stove. Make sure to turn off burners as soon as you take the pot off.

row.entry: Store knives in a wooden block or in a drawer
Make sure the knives are out of the reach of children. Follow these knife safety tips to prevent injury
Never cook in loose clothes and keep long hair tied back
You don’t want anything accidentally catching fire (not to mention hair ending up in the food!)
Never cook while wearing dangling jewelry
A bracelet can get tangled around pot handles.
Turn pot handles away from the front of the stove.
Children can’t grab them, and adults can’t bump into them if they’re out of the way.
Don’t let temperature-sensitive foods sit out in the kitchen
Raw meat, fish, and certain dairy products can spoil quickly, so refrigerate or freeze them right away
Keep the floor dry so that no one slips and falls
Separate raw meat and poultry from other items whenever you use or store them
This precaution avoids cross-contamination of harmful bacteria from one food to another.
Wash your hands before handling food and after handling meat or poultry
Hands can be a virtual freight train of bacteria
